intro: Ipomopsis candida, commonly known as the white trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies due to their nectar-rich structure. Ipomopsis candida is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
